Utterance: Hi again, it's great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie, I've been okay, just trying to manage my thoughts.
That's understandable. Last time, we talked about your financial worries and how they affect your mood. Have there been any changes in that area?
Not really. I'm still stressed about money. I've been applying to jobs, but nothing has come through yet.
I can imagine that must be frustrating. Have you found any strategies that help you cope with that stress?
I've been trying to meditate a bit, but it's hard to focus when my mind is racing.
Meditation can be challenging, especially when you're feeling anxious. Would you like to explore some other coping strategies together?
Sure, that sounds good.
One technique that might help is grounding exercises. They can bring you back to the present moment and help reduce anxiety. Would you like to try one?
Yeah, I’d be open to that.
Great! Let’s try a simple one. Take a moment to notice your surroundings. Can you describe three things you can see right now?
Um, I see my dog lying on the couch, a plant in the corner, and a picture of my family on the wall.
Good job! Now, can you focus on two things you can hear?
I can hear the sound of traffic outside and my dog breathing.
Excellent. And finally, can you identify one thing you can touch?
I can feel the fabric of my couch.
Perfect. This exercise helps anchor you in the present. How do you feel after doing that?
I feel a little calmer, actually.
That’s wonderful to hear! It’s a good tool to have in your toolbox. Have you had any moments of joy or happiness since our last session?
I took my dog to the park last weekend. It was nice to get out and enjoy the fresh air.
That sounds lovely! Spending time with your dog can be very therapeutic. Did you notice any changes in your mood while you were out?
Yeah, I felt lighter, like I could breathe easier.
That’s great! It sounds like nature and being active can help improve your mood. How often do you think you could incorporate that into your week?
Maybe I could try to go to the park a couple of times a week.
That sounds like a solid plan. Let’s set that as a goal for next week. How does that sound?
I like that idea!
Fantastic! Now, I’d like to revisit the topic of your drinking. How has it been since you quit?
It’s been tough at times, especially when I’m feeling down. I miss that escape.
That’s understandable. It’s common to feel that way when you’re adjusting to new habits. Have you found any alternatives to help you cope with those feelings?
I’ve been trying to drink more water and herbal tea, but it’s not the same.
It’s a good start! Finding healthier alternatives can be challenging. We can also explore other activities that might serve as distractions or coping mechanisms. What do you think about that?
I’d be open to it.
How about we brainstorm some activities that you enjoy or have wanted to try?
I used to like painting and drawing. I haven’t done that in years.
That sounds like a wonderful creative outlet! Would you be willing to set aside some time to explore that again?
Yeah, I could try that. Maybe I’ll pick up some supplies this weekend.
That’s a great idea! It could be a nice way to express yourself and relieve some stress.
I hope so.
Remember, it’s all about progress, not perfection. If you find it hard to get started, that’s okay. Just take it one step at a time.
Yeah, I need to remind myself of that.
You’re doing well. Is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to discuss?
I guess I’m just worried about how long this job search will take.
It’s natural to feel that way, especially when finances are tight. Have you considered reaching out to any networks or groups that could assist you in your job search?
I haven’t really thought about that. I guess I could.
Networking can sometimes open up opportunities you might not find on job boards. It might be worth exploring.
Yeah, I could reach out to some old colleagues.
Absolutely! It’s a great way to reconnect and see if they know of any openings.
Thanks for the suggestion.
You’re welcome! Let’s make that a goal for the week too.
Okay, I’ll try to do that.
Great! Before we wrap up, is there anything specific you’d like to focus on for our next session?
Maybe we could dive deeper into my anxiety and how to manage it.
That sounds like an important topic to explore. We can definitely do that. Thank you for sharing today, and I look forward to hearing how your week goes!
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate it.
Take care, and see you next time!
Bye!
